references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduced Latent Diffusion Models (LDMs) for image generation, which is a foundational technique for many of the video generation and tokenization methods discussed, making it highly relevant to the core concepts of VidTok.

This work introduces the concept of denoising diffusion probabilistic models, a fundamental technique for generating high-quality images and videos from noise, and underlies many of the video generation models used for comparison and as baselines in the VidTok paper.

This paper introduces Vector Quantized Variational Autoencoders (VQ-VAEs), a key technique for learning discrete representations of data, and specifically images and videos, that is central to the discrete tokenization approach explored in VidTok.

references.paper_title: Imagen Video: High definition video generation with diffusion models
references.reason: This paper presents Imagen Video, a state-of-the-art video generation model based on diffusion models, showcasing the capabilities of video generation techniques and their effectiveness in producing high-quality video content, thus motivating the need for efficient video tokenizers like VidTok.

references.paper_title: Finite scalar quantization: VQ-VAE made simple
references.reason: This work introduced Finite Scalar Quantization (FSQ), a simplified and more stable method for vector quantization that directly addresses limitations of traditional VQ and is a core component of VidTok's discrete tokenization approach, directly contributing to its performance gains.
